title: Wroughton Timberland Trail Walking Route

images.title: P L Chadwick / Stone with a hole, Croft Wood, Swindon
images.caption: Stone with a hole, Croft Wood, Swindon An intriguing stone with a hole, probably natural or maybe it has been sculpted; there is no indication. Set between a small pond, seen in the background, and the footpath, in this public area known as Croft Wood.

images.title: Towards Wroughton by Michael Dibb, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Towards Wroughton

description: This waymarked circular walk explores the area around the Wiltshire village of Wroughton. On the walk you will pass through Croft Wood where there are some interesting sculptures and mountain bike trails. You'll then head along Ladder Lane and Buredrop Wood where there are some nice views of the surrounding countryside. The village is located just south of Swindon where you can continue your walking along the Wilts and Berks Canal on the Swindon Canal Circular Walk. Coate Water Country Park lies just to the east and has a good waterside trail around a pretty lake. Please scroll down for the full list of walks near and around Wroughton Timberland Trail. The detailed maps below also show a range of footpaths, bridleways and cycle paths in the area.
